revision.comment: Undid revision 745836981 by [[Special:Contributions/Headbomb|Headbomb]] ([[User talk:Headbomb|talk]]) This is the name according to the union catalogue maintained by the [[National Library of Sweden]]
revision.text:
{{Infobox military award | name = Swedish Armed Forces Conscript Medal | image = [[File:FMvplSM.jpg|border|100px]] | caption = | awarded_by = [[Sweden]] | country = [[Sweden]] | type = Military medal (Decoration) | eligibility = Swedish personnel | for = Conscripts who have completed military service | campaign = | status = Dormant since 30 June 2010<ref name="Strid (2010), p. 21">{{cite web |url=http://www.fvrf.se/media/11343/unibest_2009_9_utmarkelser.pdf |title=Instruktion för Försvarsmakten Uniformsbestämmelser 2009 version 1.5: 9 Utmärkelser |publisher=Swedish Armed Forces |first=Olle |last=Strid |date=30 October 2012 |access-date=9 September 2016 |id=M7739‐350014 |page=21 |language=Swedish}}</ref> | description = | motto = "FOR NATIONAL DEFENCE" | clasps = | post-nominals = | established = 16 August 2002<ref name="TFG (2003), p. 3"/> | first_award = | last_award = | total = | posthumous = | recipients = | precedence_label = | individual = | higher = | same = | lower = | related = | image2 = [[File:FMvplSM - Försvarsmaktens värnpliktsmedalj (Sverige).png|100px|border]] | caption2 = Ribbon }}
'''Swedish Armed Forces Conscript Medal''' ({{lang-sv|Försvarsmaktens värnpliktsmedalj}}, FMvplM<ref name="Elfver (2004), p. 33">{{cite journal |url=http://numismatik.se/pdf/snt22004.pdf |journal=Svensk numismatisk tidskrift: organ för Svenska numismatiska föreningen |year=2004 |publisher=Svenska numismatiska föreningen |title=Ny medalj |trans-title=New medal |first=Frédéric |last=Elfver |location=Stockholm |number=2 |language=Swedish |id={{LIBRIS|3619171}} |page=33 |access-date=9 September 2016}}</ref> or FMvplSM<ref name="Strid (2010), p. 21"/>) is a [[Sweden|Swedish]] reward medal instituted by the [[Swedish Armed Forces]] and was awarded to conscripts.
==History== The medal was instituted on 16 August 2002 by the [[Supreme Commander of the Swedish Armed Forces|Supreme Commander]]'s letter 16991:74739.<ref name="Elfver (2004), p. 33"/><ref name="TFG (2003), p. 3"/>
==Appearance== The medal is made by silvered bronze with 31 mm diameter. The [[Obverse and reverse|obverse]] shows the Swedish Armed Forces heraldic arms and around the outer edge the text "For national defense" (''För rikets försvar''). The [[Obverse and reverse|reverse]] is blank with a [[laurel wreath]] around the outer edge and can be by the unit be fitted with the current name or [[Personal identity number (Sweden)|personal identity number]] and or year in engraving. The medal is also made in miniature. The ribbon is blue with a yellow stripe in the middle.<ref name="TFG (2003), p. 3">{{cite web |url=http://www.arnell.cc/bilder/030001-3.jpg |publisher=[[Swedish Armed Forces]] |work=Tjänstemeddelanden för försvarsmakten. TFG |title=Förtjänstmedaljer 16991:74739 |date=2003-02-26 |location=Stockholm |language=sv |id={{LIBRIS|266764}} |page=3}}</ref>
The miniature medal measures 16 mm. A copy of the medal (in a gift case with the miniature medal and service ribbon) has been added to the collections of the [[Royal Coin Cabinet]], by the Swedish Armed Forces. Conscripts were only awarded the medal, but the miniature medal can be purchased separately.<ref name="Elfver (2004), p. 33"/>
==Presenting== The medal and a diploma is awarded to conscripts as a reward for completing conscript training with military service rating of at least 10-5-5 at discharge from active service. If the basic traning is discontinued because of injury or disease received in the service, the medal is awarded if the conscript is deemed to achieve a passing grade on completion of service. The medal can be awarded only once. The medal can be awarded posthumously.<ref name="TFG (2003), p. 3"/> The medal can also be ordered by anyone who has completed his military service before 26 August 2002. Approved grade shall be authenticated in connection with the order. In 2003 approximately 14,000 conscripts received the medal.<ref name="Elfver (2004), p. 33"/>
The medal is awarded by the commanding officer (or equivalent) at the appropriate ceremony in connection with discharge. Staff who fulfills the requirements for the award of the medal but for some reason, can not attend the above are awarded in the manner decided by the commanding officer (or equivalent).<ref name="TFG (2003), p. 3"/>
==Wearing== The medal may be worn on the uniform according to the Supreme Commander's regulations on decorations to uniforms (FFS 1990:37). The award may be worn on the left side of the chest immediately after the royal and government medals. Instead of a medal, a [[service ribbon]] may be worn.<ref name="TFG (2003), p. 3"/>
